prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
At the theme park on Thursday, a five-month-old baby experienced a cardiac arrest. A woman, age 27 from Witham, Essex, has been taken into custody on charges of neglect leading to injury, in connection with the incident. The baby is currently in critical condition at the hospital. The woman has been granted bail until July 26.

Detective Constable Zoe Eele from Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit stated, "Our thoughts are with the family of the boy, who remains critically ill in the hospital following the cardiac arrest. We are collaborating with the Legoland Windsor Resort team but urge anyone with relevant information, particularly those who were queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between 11:30 am and 12:45 pm, to contact us. It is important to refrain from speculation and to respect the family's privacy during this distressing time."

No other suspects are being sought by authorities in relation to the incident.

A Legoland Windsor Resort representative shared, "On Thursday, a young visitor fell ill... Our fully-trained First Aid team promptly administered care until emergency services arrived. We will continue to work with the police in their investigation."

To engage with BBC South, follow their Facebook, Instagram, or X accounts. Share story ideas by emailing south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or using the WhatsApp number 0808 100 2240. The BBC assumes no responsibility for the content of external websites.

The woman has been released on bail until July 26.

DC Zoe Eele of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit stated, "Our thoughts go out to the family of the baby, who is critically ill in the hospital following the cardiac arrest. We are working together with the Legoland Windsor Resort team, but ask anyone with pertinent information, specifically those in the Coastguard HQ boat ride queue between 11:30 am and 12:45 pm, to contact us. It's crucial to avoid spreading rumors and to respect the family's privacy during this challenging time."

No additional suspects are being pursued by the authorities regarding the incident.

A Legoland Windsor Resort spokesperson expressed, "On Thursday, a guest became unwell... Our First Aid team, trained to handle such situations, provided assistance until emergency responders arrived. We'll continue to cooperate with the police in their investigation."

For BBC South engagement, check out their Facebook, Instagram, or X accounts. Share story suggestions by emailing south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or using the WhatsApp number 0808 100 2240. The BBC disclaims any liability for the content of external websites.

A five-month-old infant experienced a cardiac arrest at a theme park on Thursday. A 27-year-old woman from Witham is being investigated by the Essex Police for suspected negligence in relation to the baby's injuries. The baby's condition is critical, and they are currently receiving medical care at the hospital. The woman has been released on bail, with a court appearance scheduled for July 26.

Detective Constable Zoe Eele of the Thames Valley Police Child Abuse Investigation Unit extends her condolences to the family of the baby, who continue to be hospitalized following the cardiac arrest. Collaborative efforts between law enforcement and Legoland Windsor Resort personnel are underway, with a call for anyone having relevant information, particularly those in the Coastguard HQ boat ride queue between 11:30 am and 12:45 pm, to come forward. It is crucial to prevent unfounded rumors and safeguard the family's privacy during this difficult time.

Currently, no other suspects are being pursued by the authorities regarding this case.

A Legoland Windsor Resort spokesperson notes, "One of our guests became unwell on our property... Our First Aid team reacted swiftly until emergency services arrived. We're assisting the police in their inquiry."

A five-month-old baby suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park on Thursday. The Essex Police are examining a 27-year-old woman from Witham as a possible suspect. The baby's condition is grave, and they are receiving medical attention at the hospital. The woman has been granted bail, with her trial set for July 26.

DC Zoe Eele of the Thames Valley Police Child Abuse Investigation Unit extends her sympathies to the family of the baby, who continue to be hospitalized due to the cardiac arrest. The Essex Police and Legoland Windsor Resort staff are collaborating on the investigation. Witnesses who hold crucial information, particularly those in the Coastguard HQ boat ride queue between 11:30 am and 12:45 pm, are encouraged to contact the authorities. It's crucial to prevent the dissemination of unverified reports and respect the privacy of the family during this difficult period.

At present, no other suspects are being probed by the authorities concerning the Legoland Windsor Resort occurrence.

A Legoland Windsor Resort representative states, "One of our patrons fell ill on our premises... Our First Aid team responded promptly until the arrival of emergency services. We're helping the police with their investigation."
